msContents.summary: Tax register, recording the daily collection of money taxes in the village of Karanis; the name of each tax-payer paying the poll-tax is cross-referenced with a page of another register, where taxpayers were listed geographically

msItemStruct.note: Due to the size of this tax roll (P.Mich. IV/1, 225 + IV/2, 358), its content has been divided in the present database into several cards (one for each column).
Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

supportDesc.support: 1 papyrus ; col. 185-186: 18 x 27.1 cm; total size: ***

condition.ab: Col. 185: broken off on the left side (and on the right side of col. 186)

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: [Onnophris] son of Petheus and Ptolema grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 192)
[Mysthes son of Phaesis] and Aynchis grandson of Mysthes (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 189)
[Dionysios] son of Tepheros, [apator] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 162)
[Ptolemaios] son of Onnophris and Tapetheus grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 218)
[Pakysis son of Phanomgeus] and Tepheros grandson of Pakysis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 196)
[Pakysis son of Phasis] and Tanomgeus grandson of Esouris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 196)
[Pasoknopaios son of Phasis] and Tanomgeus grandson of Esouris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 199)
[Orsenouphis son of Pakysis] and Tapetheus grandson of Artemidoros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 194)
[Petsiris son of Pasoknopaios] and Heros [grandson of Petsiris] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 211)
[Onnophris son of Pasoknopaios] and Heros [grandson of Petsiris] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
[Castrensis, doulos of Thaisarion] alias Nebsosis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)
[Pamonneios (Pamonneouis) son of Anchorimphis] and Didymarion [grandson of Pamonneios] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 197)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: (Col.) 185;;(Phaophi 27, continued);[Onnophris], son of Petheus and Ptolema, grandson of Petheus, for ch(--): 4 drachmai; (and) the remainder of the ch(--);[- - - son of - - -] and Tasoucharion, grandson of Petesouchos, for ch(--): 8 drachmai;[Mysthes, son of Phaesis] and Aynchis, grandson of Mysthes: the remainder of the ch(--);[Dionysios, of unknown father, his mother being] Tepheros: the remainder of the ch(--);[Ptolemaios], son of Onnophris and Tapetheus, grandson of Petheus, [for guards: 5 drachmai]; for guard towers: 1 drachme 1 obol. Total: 6 drachmai 1 obol.;[Pakysis, son of Phanomgeus] and Tepheros, grandson of Pakysis: the remainder of the ch(--);[Pakysis, son of Phasis] and Tanomgeus, grandson of Esouris, for ch(--): 4 drachmai;[Pasoknopaios], his brother, (born) of the same mother, for ch(--): 4 drachmai;Total for the day: 4[*] drachmai 12 obols.;;[On the 28th, similarly:];[- - -] Apolinarius - (through) the son of Loukias - [for garden land of year 13: for apomoira], 11 drachmai 1 1/2 obols; for olive (transportation), 1 [drachme] 3 1/2 obols; for naubion, 1 drachme 1/2 obol 2 chalkoi; for supplements, 2 drachmai 5 obols; [for eparourion, 7 drachmai 3 obols]; for supplements, 3 1/2 obols; for kollybos, 2 1/2 obols. Total: 25 drachmai 1 1/2 obols 2 chalkoi. (Lost in left margin: [24 drachmai 12 obols].);[Orsenouphis, son of Pakysis] and Tapetheus, grandson of Artemidoros: the remainder of the ch(--);[- - -, son of - - -] and Thaesis, [grandson of - - -], for ch(--): 4 drachmai;[- - -, son of - - -] and Heras, [grandson of - - -], for ch(--): 4 drachmai;[Petsiris, son of Pasoknopaios] and Heros, [grandson of Petsiris]: the remainder of the ch(--);[Onnophris, his brother, (born) of the] same [mother]: the remainder of the ch(--);[- - -, son of - - -] and Taorsenouphis, [grandson of - - -], for ch(--): 4 drachmai;[Total for the day]: 44 drachmai 14 obols.;;[On the 29th, similarly:];[Castrensis, slave of Thaisarion] also called Nebsosis: the remainder of the ch(--);[- - -, son of - - -] and Thaisas, [grandson of - - -], for ch(--): 4 drachmai 27 obols;[- - -, son of - - -] and Thaisas, [grandson of - - -], for ch(--): 4 drachmai;[- - -, son of - - -] and Tasoucharion, [grandson of - - -]: the remainder of the ch(--);[Pamonneios, son of Anchorimphis] and Didymarion, [grandson of Pamonneios], for ch(--): 4 drachmai;[- - -], for ch(--): 28 obols;[Total for the day: 24 drachmai 8 obols]
